item.title: 巴西农业部门将在《联合国气候变化框架公约》缔约方大会第三十届会议上阐述其气候理由
item.description: 农业是巴西最大的温室气体排放源。随着气候谈判将于下月在巴西举行，该行业正在宣传自己是气候领导者，可以帮助减少地球变暖的污染。【原文：Agriculture is Brazil’s biggest source of greenhouse gas emissions. With climate talks set to get underway in the country next month, the industry is making the pitch that it’s a climate leader that can help cut planet-warming pollution.】

item.title: 诺贝尔奖的获得为从空气中制造水提供了商业理由
item.description:
一家由诺贝尔奖获得者创立的初创公司正在将水资源紧张地区的数据中心作为其技术的客户。【原文：

A startup founded by a Nobel laureate is targeting data centers in water-stressed regions as customers for its technology.

】

item.title: 世界气象组织称 2024 年全球碳排放量增幅创历史新高
item.description:
激增的原因可能是野火更加严重，陆地和海洋吸收的碳减少。【原文：

The surge was likely due to more severe wildfires and less carbon being absorbed by land and oceans.

】

item.title: 巴西污染严重的农业部门备受全球瞩目
item.description:
农业企业是该国最大的温室气体排放者和政治力量，计划在 COP30 气候峰会上展示可持续做法。【原文：

Agribusiness — the country’s biggest greenhouse gas emitter and a political force — plans to showcase sustainable practices at the COP30 climate summit.

】

item.title: 核新创公司将在德克萨斯 A&M 校园部署试验性微反应器
item.description: 随着人工智能对能源需求的不断增长，小型模块化反应堆的竞争也日趋白热化。【原文：Last Energy Inc., an Austin-based nuclear startup, plans to test its pilot microreactor on a campus of Texas A&M University as the race for small modular reactors heats up amid growing energy demand for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 南非与中国市政当局签署太阳能电池板发电厂协议
item.description: 南非和中国市政当局达成了一项协议，将建造一座价值 3500 万美元的太阳能电池板组装厂，这推动了比勒陀利亚吸引国际投资的计划，而国际投资是促进地区发展所必需的。【原文：South African and Chinese municipalities agreed a deal to construct a $35 million solar-panel assembly plant, a boost to Pretoria’s plans to attract international investment needed to promote district-level development.】

item.title: 灾害保险损失连续六年超过 1000 亿美元
item.description: 2025 年，全球自然灾害造成的保险损失已超过 1,000 亿美元，尽管飓风活动受到抑制，导致第三季度的保险费用异常低廉。【原文：Global insurance losses from natural disasters have eclipsed $100 billion in 2025, even as subdued hurricane activity has resulted in unusually low third-quarter costs so far.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚通过新规则向外国买家重新开放碳市场
item.description: 印度尼西亚重新向外国买家开放碳信用额市场，结束了多年来阻碍该行业发展的不确定性。【原文：Indonesia reopened its carbon credits market to foreign buyers, ending years of uncertainty that have curbed the sector’s development.】

item.title: 价值 100 亿美元的生物技术公司为制造犀牛设定四年目标
item.description: 一家价值 100 亿美元的生物技术公司和来自世界各地的科学家旨在应用基因编辑技术，并使用代孕母亲，在四年内开始将北方白犀牛从濒临灭绝的边缘拯救回来。【原文：A biotech valued at $10 billion and scientists from around the world aim to apply gene editing and use a surrogate mother to begin bringing back the northern white rhino from the brink of extinction within four years.】

item.title: 印度将收紧绿色电力规则以保障电网稳定
item.description: 印度计划收紧可再生能源规则以保护电网稳定，要求太阳能和风能生产商更严格地遵守供应计划，否则将面临处罚和收入损失。【原文：India plans to tighten rules on renewable energy to protect its grid stability, requiring solar and wind power producers to stick more closely to their supply schedules or face penalties and loss of revenue.】

item.title: 全球投资者为气候技术投入更多资金
item.description:
清洁能源公司、电动汽车制造商和其他绿色企业在2025年前九个月吸引了560亿美元的资金，比2024年全年还多。【原文：

Clean energy companies, EV makers and other green firms attracted $56 billion in the first nine months of 2025 — more than in all of 2024.

】

item.title: 新加坡将对航班征收绿色航空燃油税
item.description: 新加坡国会周二通过一项法案，对离境航班征收固定税费，以减少排放并支持航空公司使用可持续航空燃料。【原文：Singapore’s parliament passed a bill on Tuesday introducing a fixed levy on departing flights to cut emissions and support the use of sustainable aviation fuel by airlines.】

item.title: 英国必须为地球变暖超过巴黎协定目标做好准备
item.description: 英国政府官方气候顾问表示，由于全球很可能无法实现《巴黎协定》中限制全球变暖的目标，英国应做好应对更多极端天气的准备。【原文：The UK should prepare for more extreme weather as the world will likely miss the Paris Agreement’s target to limit global warming, the government’s official climate adviser said.】

item.title: 欧盟领导人呼吁在气候辩论中优先考虑工业问题
item.description: 欧盟领导人准备在下周举行的峰会上强调，在雄心勃勃的绿色转型期间保持欧盟工业竞争力的重要性。【原文：European Union leaders are poised to highlight the importance of keeping the bloc’s industry competitive during its ambitious green transition when they meet for a summit next week.】

item.title: 巴西承诺在 COP30 会议上将清洁燃料翻两番
item.description: 巴西正在与日本合作，为到 2035 年将可持续燃料生产翻两番的全球承诺赢得支持，努力推动技术发展，帮助交通和能源系统实现脱碳。【原文：Brazil is working with Japan to win support for a global pledge to quadruple sustainable fuel production by 2035, an effort to boost the technology to help decarbonize transport and energy systems.】

item.title: 专家小组称印度需要 2 170 亿美元才能实现 2047 年核目标
item.description: 根据印度电力部小组周二发布的报告，印度将需要近19.3万亿卢比（约合2170亿美元）的投资，才能实现到2047年安装1000万千瓦核电容量的目标。【原文：India will require nearly 19.3 trillion rupees ($217 billion) of investment to reach its target of installing 100 gigawatts of nuclear power capacity by 2047, according to a power ministry panel’s report, published Tuesday.】

item.title: 摩根大通称美国需要可再生能源来满足不断增长的能源需求
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan）表示，美国需要可再生能源为其科技产业的增长提供动力。在今天上午接受彭博电视采访时，该银行可持续解决方案全球主管丘卡-乌蒙纳（Chuka Umunna）表示，这与气候或环境无关，而是为了实现自给自足。【原文：JPMorgan says the US needs renewables to power growth in its tech industry. In an interview with Bloomberg Television this morning, the bank’s global head of sustainable solutions Chuka Umunna said it’s not about climate, or the environment, but about becoming self-sufficient.】

item.title: 航运业准备应对引发美国关税威胁的碳税
item.description: 世界航运监管机构即将批准对航运业的排放征收全球费用，特朗普政府因此威胁要征收关税。【原文：The world’s shipping regulator is on the verge of green-lighting a global charge on the industry’s emissions, something that has prompted the Trump administration to threaten tariffs in response.】

item.title: 摩根大通称，如果没有风能和太阳能，美国有可能无法实现能源目标
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：The US will struggle to generate the energy it needs to power growth in its tech industry without including wind and solar, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s global head of sustainable solutions.】

item.title: 肯尼亚航空公司寄希望于国产生物燃料吸引绿色投资
item.description: 肯尼亚航空公司（Kenya Airways Plc）的使命是证明可持续航空燃料可以在非洲生产，这有可能为该公司寻求融资以减少排放提供新的途径。【原文：Kenya Airways Plc is on a mission to prove that sustainable aviation fuel can be made in Africa, potentially giving it a new way to seek financing to cut its emissions.】

item.title: 英国降低获取公共洪水防御资金的门槛
item.description: 由于气候变化增加了房屋面临的风险，英国正在使洪水防御项目更容易获得公共资金。【原文：The UK is making it easier for flood defense projects to access public funds as climate change increases the risk to homes.】

item.title: 英国隔热计划使大多数房屋外部工程存在缺陷
item.description: 几乎所有利用两个政府资助项目安装了外墙保温材料的英国家庭都因工艺问题而存在潮湿和发霉的风险。【原文：Nearly all British homes that had external wall insulation installed with funding from two government-run programs were left with faulty workmanship that risks damp and mold.】

item.title: 核电初创公司将在曼哈顿项目现场建造反应堆工厂
item.description: Radiant Industries Inc.是一家总部位于加利福尼亚州的核电初创公司，计划在田纳西州的一个曾是曼哈顿项目一部分的地点为其反应堆建造一座工厂。【原文：Radiant Industries Inc., a California-based nuclear startup, plans to build a factory for its reactors at a site in Tennessee that was once part of the Manhattan Project.】

item.title: 墨西哥暴雨导致五个州 64 人死亡、65 人失踪
item.description: 墨西哥政府表示，上周的暴雨导致五个州的 64 人死亡，另有 65 人失踪。【原文：Heavy rains in Mexico last week left 64 people dead and another 65 missing across five states, the government said.】

item.title: 欧洲立法者同意大幅削减 ESG 指令
item.description: 在来自欧盟最大成员国的巨大压力下，欧盟立法者同意继续大幅削减一系列可持续发展指令。【原文：European Union lawmakers agreed to move ahead with major cuts to a set of sustainability directives, after intense pressure from the bloc’s biggest member states.】

item.title: 为什么新西兰降低甲烷目标会使地球变暖？
item.description: 新西兰是世界上最大的乳制品出口国之一，也是 "全球甲烷承诺 "的签署国之一，但本周末却降低了其 2050 年减少畜牧业和农业活动甲烷排放的目标。【原文：New Zealand, one of the world’s largest dairy exporters and a signatory of the Global Methane Pledge, this weekend watered down its 2050 target for cutting methane emissions from livestock and farming activities.】

item.title: Citadel 收购 FlexPower 推动欧洲电力交易
item.description: 对冲基金巨头 Citadel 同意收购德国电力交易公司 FlexPower，以扩大其在天然气和电力市场蓬勃发展的全球影响力。【原文：Citadel agreed to buy German power-trading company FlexPower as the hedge fund giant extends its global reach in the booming natural gas and power markets.】

item.title: 最严重的野火越来越频繁
item.description:
据最新研究显示，自 1980 年以来，全球损失最惨重的火灾中有近一半发生在过去十年中。【原文：

Nearly half of the costliest fires around the world since 1980 happened over the past decade, according to new research.

】

item.title: 伦敦昂贵的写字楼翻新将中国业主推向退出之路
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由中国政府支持的银杏树投资公司正在考虑退出伦敦的一处黄金商业地产，以避免花费巨资进行翻修。【原文：Gingko Tree Investment, which is backed by the government of China, is considering pulling out of a prime piece of commercial real estate in London to avoid having to spend money on a costly refurbishment, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国和欧盟在削减全球航运排放投票前发生争执
item.description: 在本周的投票之前，欧盟和美国就削减全球航运业碳排放量的提案发生了争执，华盛顿威胁要惩罚支持该计划的国家。【原文：The European Union and US have squared off over a proposal to slash the global shipping industry’s carbon emissions ahead of a vote this week, with Washington threatening to penalize countries that back the plan.】
